IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: To plan & develop recovery and detoxification programs for alcoholics and provide a full continuum of intervention and treatment services for individuals and families affected by alcohol and drug abuse.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Arapahoe House, Inc. was originally incorporated for the purpose of planning and developing recovery and detoxification programs for alcoholics. This mission was subsequently expanded to encompass the provision of a full continuum of intervention and treatment services for individuals and families affected by alcohol and drug use.
IRS990.Description: Alcohol and drug detoxification program for 24,458 client days.

Activity2.Description: Alcohol and drug residential program for 24,618 client days.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: Lobbyists were hired to advise Arapahoe House when state or federal legislation is introduced which would affect government contracts and other funding.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Arapahoe House adopted guidance related to uncertainty in income taxes in the Financial Accounting Standard Board's Accounting Standards Codification Topic 740 on July 1, 2009. After evaluating the tax positions taken, none are considered to be uncertain; therefore, no amounts have been recognized as of June 30, 2010. If incurred, interest and penalties associated with tax positions are recorded in the period assessed as interest expense. No interest or penalties have been assessed as of June 30, 2010. Tax years that remain subject to examination include 2007 through 2010.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: All fundraising activities for Arapahoe House, Inc. are performed by Arapahoe House Foundation as part of their exempt purpose. The associated fundraising expenses are reported by the Arapahoe House Foundation.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Business or Family Relationship of Officers, Directors
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: John Fitzgibbons and Adrienne Ruston Fitzgibbons are married.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Review of Return by Governing Body
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The tax preparers present the tax return to the Board of Directors prior to filing of the return.

The organization has a written conflict of interest policy which is enforced by the organization and the board. The CFO periodically provides a questionnaire to the board to monitor any potential conflicts of interest.

The Human Resources Department of the organization provides a compensation survey to the board of directors for their review. A compensation committee selected by the board then meets to discuss compensation for the CEO. All compensation is subsequently approved by the board. Salary surveys from Mountain States Employers Council and other providers for nonprofits are utilized in determining the compensation of other officers.
Governing documents, policies and financial statements of the organization are provided upon request.

By resolution adopted by a majority of the directors then in office, the board of directors may designate from among its members an executive committee which, to the extent provided in the resolution establishing such committee, shall have and may exercise all of the authority of the board of directors, except as prohibited by statute. One-third of the number of members of the Executive Committee fixed in accordance with these bylaws shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business at any meeting of the Executive Committee.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Schedule K, Part I, Column (f) and Part II, Line 5
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Part I, Column (f) The bond issuance was to advance refund the organization's 1991A and 1991B bonds, and to finance the renovation, equipment, and improvement of the organization's health facilities. Part II, Line 5 Of the $174,378 issuance costs from proceeds, $22,250 related to the issuer's fee and $83,928 related to credit enhancement fees.
